title: Paektu Mountain
summary: Paektu Mountain (Korean: 백두산; Hanja: 白頭山), also known as Baekdu Mountain and in China as Changbai Mountain (simplified Chinese: 长白山; traditional Chinese: 長白山), is an active stratovolcano on the Chinese–North Korean border.[3] At 2,744 m (9,003 ft), it is the highest mountain of the Baekdudaegan and Changbai ranges. Koreans assign a mythical quality to the volcano and its caldera lake, considering it to be their country's spiritual home.[4] It is the highest mountain in Korea and Northeast China.[5]
